title: Example Idea 1
author: SF Integration Service Account
content: This is a description for an example idea.

title: Give users the option to turn off lazy loading on the grid and choose pagination, or vice versa. ( Hybrid page-loading strategy)
author: Jackie Tsang
content: Today, the Conga grid uses pagination to display pages of records, and the Salesforce Datatable component uses lazy loading to show infinite records. The new idea is to provide both options to users, where the admin can set up a default page-loading preference, and end-users would be able to switch preferences based on their needs. For example, we allow them to toggle off lazy loading on the UI so that the pagination component will appear.

title: [Copy] Only Successful login should be counted as a login count for Lite users
author: Ramya Dasaratha
content: While conting the logins for Lite users only Successfull Logins should be counted and not the failed ones.

title: Is there any way to add clickable links to documents sent from Conga Sign before Customer Signs
author: Josie Panergo
content: Hello, the documents sent for signing from their sandbox environment will include hyperlinks to terms and conditions that the customer signing these can normally click to open and view before signing when we aren't using Conga Sign yet, however the Conga Sign page appears to just be an image preview of the merged document when the signer click to sign, so links are not working for those signing. Is there any way to add clickable links to documents sent for signing? Or can this be added to Conga Sign's Feature?

title: Optional Message field character limit in Conga Sign
author: Hanah Bengson
content: The customer would like Optional Message field character limit in Conga Sign.

title: Watermark restriction on Draft Agreement
author: Jai Patel
content:
Business requirement is – to have capability to control the availability of watermark on generated documents and when all approvals, on agreement and clauses, are done then only user should have capability to remove that watermark.

Benefit – controlled behaviour so that compliance issues can be tackled where sales users do not go and share a contract document without approvals.

title: Allow email address to be used for 2FA (not just SMS)
author: Colton Lederer
content:
Today, when sending a form for signature, this group has physicians being sent 2 items; the email containing the form to sign, and an email containing the code to use so they can click into the link on first email to view the form. This prevents the physicians from forwarding the email and allows for 2FA.


If physicians needed to use their cell phone, a lot of additional data would need to be populated in Salesforce and additional consent forms would need to be signed by the physicians.


They are using S-Docs and S-Sign.


Account: Loblaw

Potential sign licenses 300-400

title: Accessibility Issue. Need to be able to use Screen reader with Sign emails.
author: David Vernall
content:
Due to the sign email being a graphic, they cannot be read by screen readers and therefore visually impaired customers cannot use our product.

Case 00783515

title: I think it would be helpful to be able to pull Generated Quote and SBQQ Quote Documents from where they are stored. Another idea would be to have an Esignature plugin that works with CPQ..
author: Angelie Camasis
content:
The customer is using a Salesforce CPQ to generate documents but docs are saved on there personal folder and no option to save under files. Conga sign can't automatically find the generated docs. And so they will need to always download the generated docs which are against their privacy policy since docs include sensitive information. Need to download and manually upload to Conga Sign interface before sending for signature.


Customer suggestion:

I think it would be helpful to be able to pull Generated Quote and SBQQ Quote Documents from where they are stored. Another idea would be to have anEsignature plugin (https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.cpq_dev_api.meta/cpq_dev_api/cpq_esp_plugin.htm) that works with CPQ.


In the meantime, we may be forced to explore other solutions like docusign, who might offerthis type of plugin (https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_prepare_for_docusign.htm&type=5) .

title: Control file name for items uploaded by signer
author: David Vernall
content:
We need to know, at a glance, the contents of files that get uploaded, and by whom. Please add a new parameter to the Attachment tag: "filename":"{{contact_firstname}} {{contact_lastname}} - [arbitrary text]"

title: The ability to change the view of the Sign UI, based on the specific tablet/mobile device being used.
author: Matt Penrod
content: Since each tablet/mobile device has differences in how mobile experiences are displayed, users are expereincing different Sign UI issues based on the specific device that's being used. Being able to change/set the view of the Sign UI would help customers who utilize various different devices for their Sign transactions.

title: The possibility to hide tags or make them more transparent, for contract visibility
author: Corey Purdy
content: Some sign tags can obscure some text on a contract, no matter the size. Being able to temporarily hide or make the tags much more transparent can help with making the contract more readable, especially when using in-person signing.
